properties.Title: President Wilson at Neighborhood House - #500
properties.Source: Original version: 3.5 x 5.5 in. gelatin silver contact print; DC Public Library, Special Collections, P31 Willard R. Ross Postcard Collection, Box 1, Streets - N - SW
properties.Description: Woodrow Wilson stands in the front of a convertible automobile stopped in the intersection of what was then N and Union Streets SW.  Wilson, the driver of the car, and two woman in the back look east at something happening on N Street. A crowd gathered under a tree near the car and people in front of 485 N Street also look in the same direction. Two Secret Service agents look at the photographer. Written on the reverse is "Barney Neighborhood House, 470 N Street SW." Wilson had only been President of the US for two months when the photo was taken.
properties.Rights: No known restrictions on the publication of this image.
properties.Notes: Number in title was assigned by Willard Ross
properties.Creator: Ross, Willard R., 1860-1948
properties.Subject: Wilson, WoodrowAutomobilesSecret service

properties.Source: Original version: 3.5 x 5.5 in. gelatin silver real photo postcard; The Historical Society of Washington, D.C., Postcard Collection
properties.Description: View of the Pennsylvania Avenue NW elevation of the Metropolitan Hotel with a partial view of the attached commercial buildings to the east and west.  A portion of the National Hotel on the northeast corner of Pennsylvania Avenue and 6th Street NW is also visible.  Multiple automobiles, tourist buses, and streetcars are passing the hotel.  The postcard's title notes that the site previously was Brown's Hotel, where Lajos Kossuth once stayed.  The reverse  of the postcard is stamped "Proctor Collection" and someone has written "Sunday Magazine 11/15."
properties.Rights: No known restrictions on the publication of this image.
properties.Notes: Number in title was assigned by Willard Ross
properties.Creator: Ross, Willard R., 1860-1948
properties.Owner: The Historical Society of Washington, D.C.

properties.Title: Garden of Allah, Washington, D.C. - #29
properties.Source: Original version: 3.5 x 5.5 in. gelatin silver real photo postcard; The Historical Society of Washington, D.C., Postcard Collection
properties.Description: Close-up view of the sculptural sphinxes and Egyptian designs at the bottoms of "Garden of Allah" columns installed at the intersection of Pennsylvania Avenue and 15th Street NW for a convention of the Ancient Arabic Order of the Nobles of the Mystic Shrine.  View is looking north on 15th from Pennsylvania.  A man in a fez walks toward the camera and a sign at base of the south column reads, "W.A. THOMAS DECORATOR 1746 U ST NW."
properties.Rights: No known restrictions on the publication of this image.
properties.Notes: Number in title was assigned by Willard Ross; Date from another copy of this postcard held by DC Public Library (dcpl_p031_298 #1295)

properties.Title: Unveiling ceremonies, statue of Baron von Steuben - #8
properties.Source: Original version: 3.5 x 5.5 in. gelatin silver real photo postcard; The Historical Society of Washington, D.C., Postcard Collection
properties.Description: A parade of fraternal organizations marching for the unveiling of a statue of Baron Friedrich von Steuben by Albert Jaegers in Lafayette Park on December 7, 1910.  The marchers carry banners and flags and walk north on Jackson Place NW towards H Street NW.
